result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Hills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud/Innkeeper,etc-Nonpayment (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.21(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

3:32 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Matthew Ours present in court via telephone.  Court quashes any warrants.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant - still owes money, was homeless and starts at Applebees. Court amends JOC - starting the end of February defendant is to pay $50 per month and if not paid will need to sit 7 days in the county jail for each month not paid.  Agent to submit the paperwork.

Court adjourned at 3:37 p.m.

of Conviction (DOC-37) - probation is extended for a period of one year from 01/24/2018 to 01/24/2019 or until all obligations have been paid.

2:13 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via vdieo and without counsel.  Agent Matthew Ours is not present in court.  Court goes over the prior hearing.  Statement by the defendant.  Court goes over the obligations due.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 2:15 p.m.

1:52 p.m.  Defendant not present in court, currently incarcerated in Rock County jail.  Agent Matthew Ours present in court via telephone.  Statement by Agent Ours - will not be revoking the defendant.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Agent to contact the defedannt and inform him to contact our office in regards to if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Review in 30 days.

Court adjourned at 1:53 p.m.
Probation review hearing on December 19, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

2:43 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with probation.  State concurs.  Defendan concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $500.00
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:50 p.m.
